Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

NCHart is a corporation that has developed and patented a new drug to treat heart disease. There are no substitutes for this drug, giving NCHart a monopoly.

(a) Draw a correctly labeled graph of NCHart making a positive economic profit, and show each of the following.

(i) The profit-maximizing quantity, labeled <math alttext="Q sub m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

(ii) The profit-maximizing price, labeled <math alttext="P sub m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

(b) At <math alttext="Q sub m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> from part (a)(i), is demand elastic, unit elastic, or inelastic? Explain using information from the graph.

(c) Instead of maximizing profit, suppose NCHart considers providing the new drug to as many patients as possible as long as it can generate enough revenue to cover its total costs.

(i) On your graph from part (a), show the quantity that is consistent with this goal, labeled <math alttext="Q sub z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>z</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(ii) At <math alttext="Q sub z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>z</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> from part (c)(i), is there a deadweight loss? Explain.

(d) NCHart’s patent expires next year, and a new firm, TXDrug, is considering whether to Enter this market or Stay Out. NCHart can either produce <math alttext="Q sub m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> or <math alttext="Q sub z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>z</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The firms independently and simultaneously choose their actions. The first entry in the payoff matrix represents NCHart’s payoff and the second entry represents TXDrug’s payoff. Both firms have complete information. Use the payoff matrix below to answer the following questions.

(iii) Identify the Nash equilibrium.
